description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Ankara's Heart" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Ankara's Heart

places.generalDescription: The Haci Bayram Mosque, constructed in the 15th century by Architect Mehmet Bey, is a significant Ottoman-era landmark located in Ulus. The mosque features brick outer walls on stone and is accompanied by the Haci Bayram-i Veli Tomb. Named after the prominent religious scholar Haci Bayram Veli, it reflects a blend of Seljuk and early Ottoman architectural styles with intricate tile work and ornate calligraphy.

sources.snippet: Begin your journey at the tranquil Haci Bayram Mosque, an emblem of Ottoman design, a peaceful sanctuary nestled amidst the urban bustle. Meander through quaint, cobblestone streets, soaking up the city's rich tapestry of history and culture. You'll then arrive at the monumental Roman Temple of Augustus, a testament to ancient civilization's architectural prowess and an enduring symbol of Ankara's layered history.
sources.shortName: Discover Beyond | Activity | Heartbeat of Ankara: A Romantic‚Ä¶

sources.snippet: The Haci Bayram Mosque is one of the most historically significant mosques in Ankara and Turkey. An iconic religious centre based on the 17th century and 18th-century mosque architectural styles, it is home to the mausoleum of Turkish poet and Sufi Haci Bayram Veli, whose name it takes. The site also includes a Roman Temple of Augustus where the walls depict how it looked during the Roman times.
sources.shortName: 40 Best Things to do in Ankara Turkey 2025

sources.snippet: Located on the Hacƒ± Bayram Veli Street, this is one of the most revered mosques in Ankara. With a single minaret, this landmark was constructed in the Ottoman era.
sources.shortName: Ankara, Turkey  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

sources.snippet: Constructed back in the fifteenth century, the Haci Bayram Mosque is a token of dedication to Haji Bayram Wali, the preacher and founder of the Baryam Sufi order.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ankara, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

places.name: Haci Bayram Mosque

reviews.text:
Hacƒ± Bayram Veli Mosque is one of the most beautiful and peaceful places to visit in Ankara, MashaAllah.
We visited here after exploring Ankara Castle and offered Asar Namaz in this serene environment.
The mosque holds great historical significance as one of the oldest mosques in the city, dating back to the Ottoman Empire period. Named after the Turkish Sufi and poet Hacƒ± Bayram-ƒ± Veli, it offers a fascinating blend of spiritual and historical value.

The surrounding area is equally captivating. Behind the mosque, you'll find a park with ancient signs of the past, including monuments from the Roman era, over 2100 years old. The traditional handcraft shops nearby add to the cultural richness of the experience.

In addition to its beauty and history, Hacƒ± Bayram Mosque offers excellent views of Ankara city. The ‚ôøaccessibility is well thought out, with a dedicated üÖøÔ∏èparking lot and a lift making it easy for everyone to reach the mosque.
A must-visit if you're in Ankara!

I loved my visit to the mosque. A lot if history present. New mosque is very beautiful inside. Visited the grave of Haci Bayram and offered fatiha.
There are some nice restaurants and shops around to spend time in your own or with family

The mosque was built in the early 15th century in honor of Hacƒ± Bayram Veli, a prominent Turkish Sufi and founder of the Bayrami Sufi Order. The mosque was constructed shortly after his death and became a center for spiritual learning and devotion. Over the centuries, the mosque has undergone several renovations, blending Seljuk and Ottoman architectural styles, which gives it a unique charm.

Architecture and Features

The Hacƒ± Bayram Mosque has a simple yet elegant design. Its brick and stone structure, along with its wooden roof, reflects the architectural style of its era. Inside, the mosque is adorned with beautiful calligraphy and wooden decorations. Despite its modest size, it exudes a deep sense of serenity, enhanced by the spiritual significance of the place.

Spiritual and Cultural Importance

As a spiritual hub, the mosque continues to attract both worshippers and visitors from around the country and beyond. It is particularly busy during religious holidays and special events, and many people visit the tomb of Hacƒ± Bayram Veli, located adjacent to the mosque, to pay their respects.

The proximity to the Temple of Augustus also highlights Ankara's cultural layers, with ancient Roman history sitting alongside Ottoman and Islamic heritage.

Visitor Experience

Visiting the Hacƒ± Bayram Mosque offers a peaceful and reflective experience. The surrounding area has been recently developed into a lively plaza with shops and cafes, making it an enjoyable stop for both spiritual and cultural exploration.

Overall, the Hacƒ± Bayram Mosque is a must-visit for anyone interested in Ankara's historical and religious landscape.

places.address: Hacƒ± Bayram, Sarƒ±baƒü Sk. No:13, 06050 Altƒ±ndaƒü/Ankara, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Anƒ±tkabir in Ankara is a grand mausoleum and museum dedicated to Kemal Ataturk, the founding father and first president of the Republic of Turkey. It also serves as the final resting place for Ismet Inonu, Turkey's second president. The site features a marble hall, turrets, murals, and art galleries. The Ataturk Museum within Anƒ±tkabir displays his personal items, medals, wardrobe, and gifts received during his lifetime.

sources.snippet: Anƒ±tkabir is a magnificent mausoleum dedicated to the founder and [...]. Anƒ±tkabir, Ankara, Ankara attractions, architecture, Atat√ºrk, best places to visit in Turkey, cultural heritage, historical site, mausoleum, mausoleum in Turkey, Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk, national monument, national pride, Ottoman architecture, Seljuk architecture, things to do in Ankara, tourism, travel, Turkey, Turkish history. Latest Update: Aug 18, 2024
sources.siteName: Tourism Turkey: Top Travel Spots and Tourist Attractions
sources.shortName: Ankara - Turkey: Must-Visit Destinations 2025

sources.snippet: The most prominent monument in modern Turkish history, Anitkabir is the resting place of Mustafa Kemal Attaturk, the founding father and the first president of the Republic of Turkey. If you've ever been to Turkey, it's almost hard to ignore the idea of how much Turkish people love and respect Attaturk as the founding father. That alone is a good enough reason to visit Anitkabir when you're in Ankara.
sources.shortName: 6 Historical Places To Visit in Ankara, Turkey

sources.snippet: One of the most notable modern architecture examples sitting high on Ankara‚Äôs hilltop has to be the Atat√ºrk Mausoleum, Anƒ±tkabir. It was designed by Emil Onat, the renowned Turkish architect who constructed its complex between the years 1944 to 1953. This mausoleum is known to be the sepulture place of the Turkish Republic‚Äôs first president and founder Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ankara, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: The father of the modern Turkish Republic, Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, found his resting place at the Anitkabir, a mausoleum in Ankara. Standing tall on a hilltop, this mausoleum is elaborate and carved with intricate designs. The complex has many areas to explore, like the Hall of Honor, Peacock Park, Aslanlƒ± Yol‚Äô, and Monument Block, among others.
sources.shortName: 40 Best Things to do in Ankara Turkey 2025

sources.snippet: The grand mausoleum of the founder of the modern Turkey sits overlooking the city. Apart from the tomb, the complex consists of museums and a courtyard.
sources.shortName: Ankara, Turkey  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025
A 3, 4 and 7-Day Road Trip through Romantic Turkey
Attractions & Things to Do in Ankara

places.name: Anƒ±tkabir

reviews.text: It's an impressive area and easy to navigate. Attaturk is beloved by all Turkish people for his remarkable achievements. It's definitely worth a visit if you are in Ankara. It's also free, which was a nice surprise.

Amazing place especially the informative museum. Security is tight and can take a while to clear. Our guide told us dslr cameras üì∑ are not allowed in. However,  on entry we noticed a number of people with them. At exit, asked the Security about this, and he advised that as long the camera and lens don't appear large,  it's permitted. Not advisable to take more than one lens, so take a zoom type.
Also be prepared for large crowds  especially at weekends.
Changing of guard is worth watching üëÄ. It happens every hour at quarter past hour.

The absolute best place to visit in T√ºrkiye. A memorial for the greatest leader of all time. The building is kept very well. The museum explains Atat√ºrks life and Turkeys independence war so well. The newly restored painting section has beatiful portraits of the great leader. You have to see the duty change of the guards, it happens every hour. Its really impressive. The gift shop has great souvenirs too.

places.generalDescription: Kuƒüulu Park, also known as Swan Park, is a popular urban oasis located in the heart of Ankara's bustling Tunali Hilmi shopping street. The park features picturesque walking paths, a children's playground, and a serene pond inhabited by swans, geese, and ducks. Visitors can relax on park benches and immerse themselves in the city's daily life before exploring nearby shops and cafes. At night, the park transforms with illuminated fountains and bridges creating a captivating ambiance.

sources.snippet: Ankara‚Äôs other classic park is also very romantic in the evenings when the lights illuminate the small man-made lake in the middle where swans glide to and fro. And what could be more romantic than swans?
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots For A Night Out In Ankara, Turkey

sources.snippet: Ever since it‚Äôs opening in 1995 on Tunalƒ± Hilmi Caddesi in Ankara‚Äôs √áankaya district, Cafe des Cafes has been synonymous with the sweet nostalgia of the capital, which holds high importance for so many. Meanwhile, Kuƒüulu Park, which in English literally means ‚ÄúSwan Park‚Äù and is not to be confused with the nearby A≈üƒ±klar Parkƒ±, is located in the heart of the consular neighborhood of the capital. There are grassy knolls and play areas for children, but the true highlight for many are the ponds and the parks' resident ducks and swans, which you can conveniently watch from comfortable benches lining the park.
sources.shortName: Most romantic destinations in Ankara for Valentine's Day

places.name: Kuƒüulu Park

reviews.text: Really nice park in the center of bustling city where you can relax while enjoying Nature. Many birds including swans, pigeons, ducks etc makes relaxing even more enjoyable. Water fountains give a pleasing sound that sooth your eyes as well as ears.  Highly recommended.

Nice little park in the center of the city. Not big, mostly crowded but still great place to visit. Many birds, swans, ducks. Playing area for children, many coffee shops around for parents. Clean and peaceful place. Recommend to visit for everyone

A small but beautiful park. Basically a small park area with some water at its center that some ducks and swans are swimming in it. There is banks to sit, and a restaurant to get food, drink and ice cream. There was a lot of birds like pigeons that can be fed by visitors. Good place to relax.

places.generalDescription: Botanical Park in Ankara is a serene and tranquil green space that offers respite from the hectic pace of city life. This hidden gem boasts well-established pathways bordered by mature foliage, a vast pond, seating areas, and a play area for children. It is an idyllic retreat for nature enthusiasts and serves as a stunning backdrop for photography enthusiasts.

sources.snippet: Last, but certainly not least, is the destination in the capital known for being the most romantic spot possible. Set in √áankaya and established in the 1970s, the Botanical Park is over 65,000 square meters (around 699,600 square feet) of nature that serves as a wonderful escape from the bustle of the big city. Walk along its green paths, picnic on the grassy knolls and enjoy the greenery, mature trees, flower gardens and fountains, which now serve as the top backdrop for many of the capital‚Äôs newlywed shots.
sources.shortName: Most romantic destinations in Ankara for Valentine's Day

places.name: Botanical Park

reviews.text:
This park is an amazing escape from our busy life.
They have the cutest benches and tables for you to have a quiet picnic or hangout with your friends and family. There's also a lake in the middle.

We came here around noon and the weather was beautiful. We enjoyed our food and the scenery.  It was very relaxing.

You also get to see the Atakule tower from the garden.

Hidden Gem in the Heart of Ankara

Tucked inside one of the most beautiful parks in Ankara, this caf√© is something special. Right in the middle of the park, surrounded by greenery and a peaceful water fountain, you'll find a coffee spot that's more than just a place to grab a drink.

The caf√© is built inside what used to be a greenhouse and it still holds onto that charm. You can wander through the plants, soak in the natural light, and even buy a few if something catches your eye. The whole place has this calm, airy atmosphere that makes it perfect for studying, reading, or just escaping the noise of the city.

The coffee? 9/10. The staff? Friendly and professional. And if you're feeling bold (or just bored), there's a piano you're welcome to play.

It's aesthetically beautiful, full of unique little corners perfect for photos, and easily one of the best places in town to relax or get some work done. Highly recommend

Came here during winter and it was quiet as there weren't so many people around. You can access the park through the street uphill or from a path downhill. There is a pond and it appears to be dried out during the winter. There is also a structure that looks like a greenhouse but I didn't have the chance to go inside. There is an area that appeared to be an aquarium but apparently, it wasn't open when I got there. There is also an area for kids to play but it is located way uphill not in the downhill area.

places.generalDescription: Atakule, situated in the Cankaya district of Ankara, is a must-visit destination offering a unique blend of retail therapy, dining experiences, and breathtaking views. Standing tall at 125 meters, this iconic tower provides unparalleled panoramic vistas of Ankara. The revolving restaurant within Atakule offers an exceptional dining experience with ever-changing urban landscapes as it rotates. From this vantage point, visitors can marvel at the city's rich history and diverse civilizations that once thrived here.

sources.snippet: Located in the Canakaya district, the Atakule Tower overlooks Ankara from a height of 125 meters above the sea level. The panoramic view of the city alongside good food is definitely a plus, with a revolving restaurant and a caf√©, Atakule is a great place to enjoy a romantic dinner at. The bottom structure of this tower is home to a shopping complex.
sources.shortName: 40 Best Things to do in Ankara Turkey 2025

sources.snippet: Discover Ankara's skyline from Atakule, a striking 125-metre tower in √áankaya. Opened in 1989, it is one of the tallest towers in the city. Atakule also offers breathtaking city views from its revolving restaurant.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ankara, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Take the high-speed elevator to the observation deck of Atakule Tower for an amazing view of Ankara. Photo from @scorpion5555 via Instagram.
sources.shortName: A 3, 4 and 7-Day Road Trip through Romantic Turkey

places.name: Atakule

reviews.text:
Atakule is one of the most iconic landmarks in Ankara, offering a unique blend of modern architecture, breathtaking views, and a relaxing atmosphere. Standing tall in the √áankaya district, this observation and communications tower is not just a tourist attraction-it's a symbol of the city itself.

The tower features a panoramic terrace with 360-degree views of Ankara, making it a perfect spot for photography lovers and anyone who wants to see the capital from above. Whether you visit during the day or at night, the view is truly stunning.

Inside Atakule, you'll find a variety of restaurants, caf√©s, and shops. The revolving restaurant is a special highlight-it slowly rotates while you dine, allowing you to enjoy a changing view of the city as you eat. There's also a modern shopping area at the base of the tower, with local and international brands, making it a great place to spend a few hours.

The area around Atakule is peaceful and well-maintained, perfect for a walk or a coffee break. It's also easy to access by taxi or public transportation.

Overall, Atakule is more than just a tower-it's an experience. Whether you're a local or a visitor, I highly recommend adding it to your Ankara itinerary.üå∫üå∫üå∫‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏èü§©

The arcade is luxurious and up-to-date, the prices of the various restaurants are higher than the Ankara city standard, but the food court is well priced and has a nice view of Ankara city. The cinema and massage chairs were also good.

Amazing view!
The ticket prices were 100 TL for students and 200 TL for adults to access the terrace (not the very top).
If you want to go all the way up to the highest level of Atakule, it costs 300 TL for students and 600 TL for adults.
I highly recommend visiting this place. there's a shopping center and a beautiful, peaceful park nearby.

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Anatolian Civilizations, situated on the south side of Ankara Castle, houses an extensive and unique collection of artifacts from Anatolia's significant archaeological sites. The exhibits are displayed in chronological order, spanning from the Paleolithic era to the Ottoman period.

sources.snippet: Referred to in Turkish as Ankara Kalesi and in English as the "Citadel," this commandeering castle and its walled fortifications, set above a rocky hill with a 360-degree commandeering view of the capital, is a wonderful site to visit. First founded in the eighth century B.C. by the Phrygians and rebuilt multiple times by many civilizations, including the Roman, Byzantine, Sel√ßuk and Ottoman eras.
sources.shortName: Most romantic destinations in Ankara for Valentine's Day

sources.snippet: Established in 1968, the Museum of Anatolian Civilizations is one of Ankara's most prominent tourist destinations, located in Ulus Square, close to the Statue of the Republic in Ankara city centre. This museum displays many ruins of historical monuments of Anatolia's civilizations, and tourists can take a break in the nearby Ulus Park and enjoy its distinctive greenery and caf√©s.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Tourist Places in Ankara

sources.snippet: Hands down the best museum in Ankara, the Museum of Anatolian Civilizations is definitely a must-visit spot if you travel to the capital city of Turkey. Situated not too far from Ankara Castle ( Ankara Kalesi), both places are two of the most prominent spots in Ankara indeed!. Unfortunately, I arrived in Ankara right after the snowstorm in Turkey.
sources.shortName: 6 Historical Places To Visit in Ankara, Turkey

sources.snippet: Bestowed with the title of 'Museum of the Year' in 1997 in Switzerland, the Anatolian Civilizations Museum shelters a broad collection of interesting Anatolian archaeology items. Arranged chronologically from the old Paleolithic age to the modern-day, these exhibits form the major attraction of this museum.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ankara, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Located in the Atpazarƒ± area of Ankara, the Museum of Anatolian Civilizations is based in two Ottoman buildings near the Ankara Castle. The museum houses artefacts, handicrafts, tools, and furniture, among more pieces of history from the Neolithic, Chalcolithic and Bronze ages.
sources.shortName: 40 Best Things to do in Ankara Turkey 2025

sources.snippet: The Museum of Anatolian Civilizations is reason enough to include Ankara on your Turkey itinerary. It's the only place in the country where you can grasp the full scope of Anatolia's pre-Classical-era human history.
sources.shortName: Attractions & Things to Do in Ankara

sources.snippet: Located on the southern side of the Ankara Castle, the museum has exhibits from the Palaeolithic, Neolithic, Chalcolithic, Early Bronze, Assyrian Trade Colonies, Hittite Period and many other ages.
sources.shortName: Ankara, Turkey  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025

places.name: Museum of Anatolian Civilizations

reviews.text: This collection is much bigger than I had anticipated from many of the other reviews here, and I spent longer at the museum than I had expected - two hours, and I burned out before I could absorb it all. There is an immense hoard of treasures here, from the eight thousand year old matriarch that sits at the head of the collection to the sun disk symbol of Ankara (from 2,500 BCE) to a ninth century BCE bronze cauldron to exquisite tiny icons to Roman gold and a bronze of Apollo, let alone the mesopotamian friezes and lions and reliefs. Awesome. I see why they feel they can charge ¬£10 - the collection, and many single items, are of world historic importance and ooze quality in their craftsmanship from the earliest days of civilization to the high Roman.

A gem of a museum! Has deservedly won the European Museum of the Year Award some years back.
Just after you enter the main building is a description of the 11 sections of the museum and the layout of the sections.
Then at the beginning of each section is a brief history of what is exhibited and the most important things to see.
It made the viewing very enjoyable and interesting. And the exhibits - wow!! Such a great collection. It was definitely one of the best museums I've visited!!

A must see place in Ankara! The museum is not so big but it's incredibly interesting. I've spent here 2.5 hours. The exposition is amazing, not just like in a common archeological museum.
The entrance fee is high for foreigners, this is the only fault. ‚Ç¨12 is a robbery

places.address: Kale, G√∂zc√º Sk. No:2, 06240 Ulus/Altƒ±ndaƒü/Ankara, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Cafe des Cafes, located in Ankara, is a historic market turned into a cafe that has been serving customers since 1995. The cafe offers a cozy atmosphere with original 50s coffee chairs and both indoor and outdoor seating. It's known for being the perfect spot to enjoy conversations with friends over a cup of coffee or other beverages like teas, smoothies, and even alcoholic drinks.

sources.snippet: Ever since it‚Äôs opening in 1995 on Tunalƒ± Hilmi Caddesi in Ankara‚Äôs √áankaya district, Cafe des Cafes has been synonymous with the sweet nostalgia of the capital, which holds high importance for so many. Meanwhile, Kuƒüulu Park, which in English literally means ‚ÄúSwan Park‚Äù and is not to be confused with the nearby A≈üƒ±klar Parkƒ±, is located in the heart of the consular neighborhood of the capital. There are grassy knolls and play areas for children, but the true highlight for many are the ponds and the parks' resident ducks and swans, which you can conveniently watch from comfortable benches lining the park.
sources.shortName: Most romantic destinations in Ankara for Valentine's Day

sources.snippet: The Cafe des Cafe is a place hidden in Tunalƒ± and looks like a tiny place from outside. It is always a place that I am not very good at entering and I am amazed everytime I enter. It is a warm place in every sense, and the employees are often tired to smile, so sincere.
sources.shortName: Ankara‚Äôs Classical Food Places We Cannot Give Up - Lavarla

places.name: Cafe des Cafes

reviews.text:
This place is located in a very popular street in Ankara. The food was very good. We sat outside where the ambiance was very calm and elegant. However, beware that sitting outside you most likely will be among smokers. We didn't know that.

I ordered the kabab wrap, which had the look and taste of a fajita mix. My friend ordered the kebab with potatoes and salad and it looked also good.

I will definitely return again to try their other dishes and their dessert.

Charming retro styled cafe ! Great interior and fantastic service. I tried their vegetarian breakfast and was impressed. It's very filling and reasonably priced. The apple tea was also very tasty. It's a great place for a quick coffee or a bite.

A delightful escape in the heart of Tunalƒ± - exceptional coffee, heavenly desserts, and heartfelt service.
I recently visited Cafe Des Cafe in Kavaklƒ±dere, Tunalƒ± Hilmi Cd. 83/A, √áankaya with my bestie, and it was such a delightful experience!
We ordered an Americano, a Cappuccino, and a Profiterole, and honestly - everything was absolutely delicious. The coffee was rich and smooth, and the profiterole was the perfect balance of creamy and sweet.
The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, creating such a warm and cozy atmosphere. A special shoutout to Melike, who truly went above and beyond to make our visit extra special - she was kind, attentive, and had such a lovely energy!
The cafe itself is clean, cozy, and beautifully authentic - a perfect spot to relax, catch up with a friend, or even enjoy some solo time with a good book.
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a peaceful cafe experience with amazing service and top-quality treats. üíõ

places.generalDescription: Dafne Restaurant offers high-end cuisine in a relaxed setting with outdoor seating. Housed in a beautifully renovated Ottoman house, the restaurant exudes a laid-back yet romantic atmosphere with its simple decor featuring wood paneling, a fireplace, and Ottoman chandeliers. The menu showcases traditional dishes from Turkey's Antakya region. It is known for its cozy and intimate ambiance, making it perfect for family gatherings or outings with friends. Reservations are recommended, especially for weekend brunches.

sources.snippet: Located in a lovely renovated Ottoman house, Dafne Restaurant‚Äôs simple d√©cor includes wood paneling, a fireplace with a comfy couch, and Ottoman chandeliers for a laid-back yet romantic atmosphere. Dafne also stands out with its menu, which features traditional dishes from Turkey‚Äôs Antakya region.
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots For A Night Out In Ankara, Turkey

places.name: Dafne Restaurant

reviews.text: Our local friends brought us to Dafne for our first Turkish Breakfast, or kahvalti. It was amazing! So many dishes to choose from: cheeses, fruits, tomatoes and veggies, sausage, hummus, breads, etc. Very enjoyable food, with a very warm and welcoming atmosphere and staff.
Very mediocre experience. Okay view but many items on the menu either not available or not recommended by staff. Food very average.

I recently head the pleasure of visiting Daphne restorant both for breakfast and Dining. Located in the heart of the town this hidden gem offers a cozy and intimate atmosphere.
The menu shows varieties range of options if you're looking for a nice place to go with your family or friends it's perfect option. It is commonly preferred for weekend branches so reservation is necessary.

places.address: Aziziye Mahallesi, Andrey Karlov Caddesi, Karyaƒüdƒ± Sokak No:20, √áankaya/Ankara, T√ºrkiye

places.generalDescription: Ankara Castle, an ancient fortress perched on a rocky hill, provides breathtaking panoramic views of the city. With its strong fortifications and intricate architecture, this historic site offers visitors a glimpse into Turkey's past. The castle has been used by various civilizations for defense and settlement over its 4,000-year history and has undergone numerous repairs. Inside the castle, there are houses dating back to different historical periods, providing insight into the area's evolution.

sources.snippet: Ankara Castle is one of Ankara's most prominent tourist destinations, a very old one, known for its strong fortifications, delicate architecture, and strategic location on top of a hill, enabling visitors to see Turkey's capital from all sides. Ankara Castle has many small squares used for various commercial purposes and gathering points, most notably horse market squares and sheep market. The castle's interior has houses of only two or three floors, dating back to different historical stages, and visitors can see the contemporary neighbourhood scene in stunning paintings.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Tourist Places in Ankara

sources.snippet: Conclude your intimate exploration at the awe-inspiring Ankara Castle, whose majestic walls have stood watch over the city for centuries. The romance of Ankara is unveiled in its mesmerizing mix of serene spaces, compelling architecture, and breathtaking views. This tour promises a captivating encounter with a city that harmoniously blends the old with the new, inviting visitors to dive deep into a truly romantic urban narrative.
sources.shortName: Discover Beyond | Activity | Heartbeat of Ankara: A Romantic‚Ä¶

sources.snippet: Referred to in Turkish as Ankara Kalesi and in English as the "Citadel," this commandeering castle and its walled fortifications, set above a rocky hill with a 360-degree commandeering view of the capital, is a wonderful site to visit. First founded in the eighth century B.C. by the Phrygians and rebuilt multiple times by many civilizations, including the Roman, Byzantine, Sel√ßuk and Ottoman eras.
sources.shortName: Most romantic destinations in Ankara for Valentine's Day

sources.snippet: One of Turkey's oldest sites, the Ankara Castle is a historical fortification dating back to the 7th century. The castle overlooks the city from its peak and is often associated with Ottoman, Seljuk, Roman and Byzantine empires. One of Ankara's must-visit destinations, the castle embodies different architectural styles and is home to twenty pillars and two gateways.
sources.shortName: 40 Best Things to do in Ankara Turkey 2025

sources.snippet: Built by the Phrygians and renovated by Romans, Byzantines, and Ottomans, it offers panoramic views of Ankara. Wander through historic streets filled with Ottoman-era houses, quaint shops, and art galleries, immersing yourself in centuries of culture and craftsmanship.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ankara, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Started by the Galatians, built by the Romans, the castle is situated on a hilltop in the old city. The Museum of Anatolian Civilizations is located inside the architectural marvel.
sources.shortName: Ankara, Turkey  - Tourist Places & Top Things to Do in 2025
A 3, 4 and 7-Day Road Trip through Romantic Turkey

places.name: Ankara Castle

reviews.text: We have been here twice already and we are never tired of it! You can have a cup of coffee or tea in a small cafe inside the yard. You can enjoy the great view from above. You can buy souvenirs from local people and have a taste of traditional items. Take your time to go up and admire the view!

Ankara Castle is a historical landmark with amazing panoramic views of the city. Walking through its old walls and narrow streets feels like traveling back in time. Around the castle, you can find beautiful shops with souvenirs, accessories, and charming caf√©s designed in an old traditional style. It's a must-visit spot in Ankara for history lovers and anyone who enjoys exploring authentic places

Ankara Castle is a must-visit! The panoramic views of the city from the top are absolutely breathtaking. Walking through the ancient stone walls and narrow pathways felt like stepping back in time. The atmosphere is rich with history, and there are charming shops and caf√©s nearby to explore. It's a fantastic spot for history enthusiasts and photographers alike!

places.generalDescription: The Temple of Augustus in Ankara is an ancient site dating back to the 2nd century AD. It features well-preserved inscriptions of Emperor Augustus' last will and testament, known as the Res Gestae Divi Augusti. The temple was originally built to celebrate Galatia's entry into the Roman Empire and demonstrate loyalty to Emperor Augustus. Over time, it underwent transformations, including conversion into a church during the Byzantine period.

sources.snippet: One of the most important Roman period ruins in Ankara, the Monumentum Ancyranum or the Temple of Augustus and Rome, is home to the ‚ÄúDeeds of the Divine Augustus‚Äù (Res Gestae Divi Augusti), the autobiography of the first Roman Emperor. Unfortunately, the temple can be viewed from the outside as it is in danger of collapse due to several climatic factors, including air pollution and earthquakes, an (Read More)d is not accessible to visitors for sightseeing.
sources.shortName: 40 Best Things to do in Ankara Turkey 2025

sources.snippet: You'll then arrive at the monumental Roman Temple of Augustus, a testament to ancient civilization's architectural prowess and an enduring symbol of Ankara's layered history. Conclude your intimate exploration at the awe-inspiring Ankara Castle, whose majestic walls have stood watch over the city for centuries. The romance of Ankara is unveiled in its mesmerizing mix of serene spaces, compelling architecture, and breathtaking views.
sources.shortName: Discover Beyond | Activity | Heartbeat of Ankara: A Romantic‚Ä¶

places.name: Temple of Augustus

reviews.text: Dwarfed by a minaret of a mosque of medieval Ottoman style, this temple of Augustus and Roma of the early First century is absolutely a must see if you are in Ankara, witnessing not only the triumph of Allah over the gods but also the best preserved copy of the Res Gestae Divi Augusti-the first Roman emperor's autobiography/self-propaganda-which is widely known as ‚Äúthe queen of all Roman inscriptions‚Äù. However, the inscription is not visible because the temple is far away from the protective fence. What a pity!

Historical and beautiful
It belongs to 2050 years ago. But still valuable for see and enjoy

Very historical place that is tucked away  in Ulus. It's amazing that the wall is still intact after more that 2000 years.  Ankara castle is not far away from this site. There is a beautiful park, restaurant and shops there also. A nice place to relax.  I recommend visiting when in Ankara Turkey.

places.generalDescription: Gen√ßlik Park in Ankara is a popular green space that offers a variety of attractions for visitors. The park features an outdoor theater, an artificial lake with light shows, and an amusement park known as Ankara Luna Park. It also boasts two small trains, a swimming pool, and walking paths spread across its vast 70-acre area. At night, the park comes alive with colorful lights, providing entertainment for both day and night.

sources.snippet: Spread across a vast area of 69 acres, the spectacular Genclik Park makes for one of the best places to visit in Ankara. Known popularly for its amazing water features and lush greenery, this beautiful park is home to a thrilling amusement park, a pristine swimming pool, two small trains, and a unique open-air theatre.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Ankara, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: When autumn falls, Gen√ßlik Park is an ideal place to view the changing colours of nature. Photo from @rosa10_pulat via Instagram.
sources.shortName: A 3, 4 and 7-Day Road Trip through Romantic Turkey
Attractions & Things to Do in Ankara

places.name: Gen√ßlik Park

reviews.text:
It's a youth park (gen√ßlik parkƒ±) located in the middle of the city. On my first trip to Ankara, i visited this wonderful park today. While you visit here you can find every kind of amenities, like the ferris wheel, swing ride, bout swing, pool, playground, pumper cars... I tried the boat swing. üòÑ

If you gonna go to Ankara, do visit this amazing park.  It's one of the must-go places.

A spacious and green park, great for walking or having a picnic. There are playgrounds and plenty of seating - perfect for families. Some areas could be better maintained, but overall a very pleasant place to relax!

What a sad waste of space, why even have this massive artificial lake that the locals refer to as a "pool" when you take the water out?

It is also ironic that the park is called "young park" in The overwhelming majority of the people visiting are the elderly simply loitering about?

places.generalDescription: Cafemiz is a charming and romantic caf√© located in Ankara, offering a delightful experience for breakfast and brunch. The caf√© boasts an elegant decor with white and floral patterns, creating a serene ambiance. Guests can enjoy their meal in the beautiful garden during the summer months. The menu features a variety of breakfast options, including traditional Turkish dishes, mini breakfast plates, create-your-own-omelette choices, and menemen.

sources.snippet: There‚Äôs something very kitsch about this caf√© as it‚Äôs decked out in almost rococo elements, with floral patterns, chandeliers, regal furniture, and ornate mirrors. But it‚Äôs exactly this Valentine‚Äôs Day-inspired look that makes Cafemiz a romantic place, especially the beautiful garden perfect for a candlelit dinner in the summer breeze. https://instagram.com/p/BOwPNTGgIrB/
sources.shortName: Romantic Spots For A Night Out In Ankara, Turkey

places.name: Cafemiz

reviews.text: I love the place so much! Very chic and excellent service, with good food as well. I love the design, they even have a very cute bathroom design. It is located in Ankara's best neighbourhood and it is very quiet and relaxing. They have a cat and a turtle and a nice garden :)
Amazing place you feel like you are in a historical palace and the food taste amazing
The pasta was cooked good and delicious but the portion was too little for the price. Beautiful atmosphere and friendly fluffy cat so quite doesn't bother the costumers as if they don't exist!!
